item.description: So this is completely last minute based on an opening in my schedule for this evening- and a need to wear out my dog before the week begins :)  We'll walk 5-6 miles total -the trail on the Salisbury side first, then cross over to Newburyport side and walk along the waters' edge and then up the Newbury trail (more like "in town" walking on a walking trail, but nice nonetheless).  The terrain will be level and flat, paved, so we'll keep a fairly fast pace of 3-4 miles an hour.  This will include crossing over the bridge to Newburyport (walking along the bridge sidewalk).  I'm bringing my dog, so other leashed, friendly dogs are welcome too (bring bags to clean up after your pet).
item.how_to_find_us: ACROSS FROM STRIPERS on Friedenfels Street is the trail head (next to the Marina) with plenty of parking

group.name: North Shore Not Too Intense Hikers

item.name: Last minute walk at Salisbury Rail Trail- and then beach?
